title: Finite relationship composition.
content: In order for theorems on the transitive closure of a relation to be grouped together before the concept of continuity, we really need an analogue of ` ^r ` that works on finite ordinals or finite sets instead of natural numbers.

blocks.name: relexp2
blocks.content: A set operated on by the relation exponent to the second power is equal to the composition of the set with itself. (Contributed by RP, 1-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexpnul
blocks.content: If the domain and range of powers of a relation are disjoint then the relation raised to the sum of those exponents is empty. (Contributed by RP, 1-Jun-2020.)

  coeq0((c0[^r]c2), (c0[^r]c3))

  simprl((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß Rel(c0)), c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, c3 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  simprr((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß Rel(c0)), c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, c3 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)

blocks.name: eliunov2
blocks.content: Membership in the indexed union over operator values where the index varies the second input is equivalent to the existence of at least one index such that the element is a member of that operator value. Generalized from ~ dfrtrclrec2 . (Contributed by RP, 1-Jun-2020.)

blocks.content: Simplification of zeroth power of indexed union of powers of relations. (Contributed by RP, 19-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexpxpnnidm
blocks.content: Any positive power of a cross product of non-disjoint sets is itself. (Contributed by RP, 13-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: The relational power of a subset is a subset. (Contributed by RP, 17-Jun-2020.)

thm relexpss1d(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wss(co(c0, crelexp, c1), co(c2, crelexp, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, universe))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cn0))

thm relexpss1d(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]c1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]c1))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚äÜ c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
} = {
  mpcom(w0, (c0[^r]c1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]c1), (c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚à® c1 = 0))
  sylib(w0, (c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚à® c1 = 0), c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  elnn0(c1)
  jaoi(c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, c1 = 0, (w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]c1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]c1)))
  nnind(hs0, hs1, c1, (w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]c1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]c1)), (w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]hs0)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs0)), (w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]1)), (w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1)), (w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r](hs1[+]1))‚äÜ(c2[^r](hs1[+]1))))
  imbi2d(hs0 = 1, w0, (c0[^r]hs0)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs0), (c0[^r]1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]1))
  sseq12d((c0[^r]hs0), (c2[^r]hs0), (c0[^r]1), (c2[^r]1), hs0 = 1)
  oveq2(hs0, nat1, c0, crelexp)
  oveq2(hs0, nat1, c2, crelexp)
  imbi2d(hs0 = hs1, w0, (c0[^r]hs0)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs0), (c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1))
  sseq12d((c0[^r]hs0), (c2[^r]hs0), (c0[^r]hs1), (c2[^r]hs1), hs0 = hs1)
  oveq2(hs0, hs1, c0, crelexp)
  oveq2(hs0, hs1, c2, crelexp)
  imbi2d(hs0 =(hs1[+]1), w0, (c0[^r]hs0)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs0), (c0[^r](hs1[+]1))‚äÜ(c2[^r](hs1[+]1)))
  sseq12d((c0[^r]hs0), (c2[^r]hs0), (c0[^r](hs1[+]1)), (c2[^r](hs1[+]1)), hs0 =(hs1[+]1))
  oveq2(hs0, (hs1[+]1), c0, crelexp)
  oveq2(hs0, (hs1[+]1), c2, crelexp)
  imbi2d(hs0 = c1, w0, (c0[^r]hs0)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs0), (c0[^r]c1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]c1))
  sseq12d((c0[^r]hs0), (c2[^r]hs0), (c0[^r]c1), (c2[^r]c1), hs0 = c1)
  oveq2(hs0, c1, c0, crelexp)
  oveq2(hs0, c1, c2, crelexp)
  3sstr4d((c0[^r]1), (c2[^r]1), c0, c2, w0)
  relexp1d(c0, w0)
  relexp1d(c2, w0)
  a2d(hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, w0, (c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1), (c0[^r](hs1[+]1))‚äÜ(c2[^r](hs1[+]1)))
  3exp(hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, w0, (c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1), (c0[^r](hs1[+]1))‚äÜ(c2[^r](hs1[+]1)))
  3sstr4d((c0[^r](hs1[+]1)), (c2[^r](hs1[+]1)), ((c0[^r]hs1)‚àò c0), ((c2[^r]hs1)‚àò c2), (hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß w0 ‚àß(c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1)))
  coss12d((c0[^r]hs1), c0, (c2[^r]hs1), c2, (hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß w0 ‚àß(c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1)))
  simp3(hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, w0, (c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1))
  3ad2ant2(hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, w0, (c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1), c0 ‚äÜ c2)
  syl2anc((hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß w0 ‚àß(c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1)), (c0[^r](hs1[+]1))=((c0[^r]hs1)‚àò c0), c0 ‚àà ùïå, hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  3ad2ant2(hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, w0, (c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1), c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  relexpsucnnr(c0, universe, hs1)
  syl2anc((hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß w0 ‚àß(c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1)), (c2[^r](hs1[+]1))=((c2[^r]hs1)‚àò c2), c2 ‚àà ùïå, hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  3ad2ant2(hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, w0, (c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1), c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  simp1(hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, w0, (c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1))
  relexpsucnnr(c2, universe, hs1)

  3sstr4d((c0[^r]c1), (c2[^r]c1), (= |`(dom(c0)‚ãÉ ran(c0))), (= |`(dom(c2)‚ãÉ ran(c2))), (c1 = 0 ‚àß w0))
  3syl((c1 = 0 ‚àß w0), (= |`(dom(c0)‚ãÉ ran(c0)))‚äÜ(= |`(dom(c2)‚ãÉ ran(c2))), w0, (dom(c0)‚ãÉ ran(c0))‚äÜ(dom(c2)‚ãÉ ran(c2)))
  3syl(w0, (dom(c0)‚ãÉ ran(c0))‚äÜ(dom(c2)‚ãÉ ran(c2)), c0 ‚äÜ c2, (dom(c0)‚äÜ dom(c2)‚àß ran(c0)‚äÜ ran(c2)))
  jca(c0 ‚äÜ c2, dom(c0)‚äÜ dom(c2), ran(c0)‚äÜ ran(c2))
  dmss(c0, c2)
  rnss(c0, c2)
  unss12(dom(c0), dom(c2), ran(c0), ran(c2))
  ssres2((dom(c0)‚ãÉ ran(c0)), (dom(c2)‚ãÉ ran(c2)), cid)
  eqtrd((c0[^r]c1), (= |`(dom(c0)‚ãÉ ran(c0))), (c0[^r]0), (c1 = 0 ‚àß w0))
  oveq2d(c0, crelexp, c1, nat0, (c1 = 0 ‚àß w0))
  3syl((c1 = 0 ‚àß w0), (c0[^r]0)=(= |`(dom(c0)‚ãÉ ran(c0))), w0, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  ssexd(c0, c2, universe, w0)
  relexp0g(c0, universe)
  eqtrd((c2[^r]c1), (= |`(dom(c2)‚ãÉ ran(c2))), (c2[^r]0), (c1 = 0 ‚àß w0))
  oveq2d(c2, crelexp, c1, nat0, (c1 = 0 ‚àß w0))
  simpl(c1 = 0, w0)
  3syl((c1 = 0 ‚àß w0), (c2[^r]0)=(= |`(dom(c2)‚ãÉ ran(c2))), w0, c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  simpr(c1 = 0, w0)
  relexp0g(c2, universe)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w((w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]c1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]c1)))
  diff.hs0.w((w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]1)))
  diff.hs0.w((w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]hs1)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs1)))
  diff.hs0.w((w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r](hs1[+]1))‚äÜ(c2[^r](hs1[+]1))))
  diff.hs1.w((w0 ‚Üí(c0[^r]hs0)‚äÜ(c2[^r]hs0)))
}

blocks.name: comptiunov2i
blocks.content: The composition two indexed unions is sometimes a similar indexed union. (Contributed by RP, 10-Jun-2020.)

thm comptiunov2i(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wceq(ccom(c0, c1), c2)
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, universe, ciun(s1, c3, co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)))))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s2, universe, ciun(s3, c5, co(cv(s2), c4, cv(s3)))))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s4, universe, ciun(s5, c6, co(cv(s4), c4, cv(s5)))))
  -| wcel(c3, universe)
  -| wcel(c5, universe)
  -| wceq(c6, cun(c3, c5))
  -| wss(ciun(s5, c3, co(cv(s6), c4, cv(s5))), ciun(s1, c3, co(ciun(s3, c5, co(cv(s6), c4, cv(s3))), c4, cv(s1))))
  -| wss(ciun(s5, c5, co(cv(s6), c4, cv(s5))), ciun(s1, c3, co(ciun(s3, c5, co(cv(s6), c4, cv(s3))), c4, cv(s1))))
  -| wss(ciun(s1, c3, co(ciun(s3, c5, co(cv(s6), c4, cv(s3))), c4, cv(s1))), ciun(s5, cun(c3, c5), co(cv(s6), c4, cv(s5))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s6)
  -| diffss(s3, s6)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s6)
  -| diffss(s5, s6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
  -| diffsc(s3, c5)
  -| diffsc(s4, c4)
  -| diffsc(s4, c6)
  -| diffsc(s5, c3)
  -| diffsc(s5, c5)
  -| diffsc(s5, c6)
  -| diffsc(s6, c0)
  -| diffsc(s6, c1)
  -| diffsc(s6, c2)
} = {
  mp2an(wceq(ccom(c0, c1), c2), wfun(ccom(c0, c1)), wfun(c2))
  mp2an(wfun(ccom(c0, c1)), wfun(c0), wfun(c1))
  funmpt2(s0, c0, universe, ciun(s1, c3, co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1))))
  funco(c0, c1)
  funmpt2(s4, c2, universe, ciun(s5, c6, co(cv(s4), c4, cv(s5))))
  mp2ani(wa(wfun(ccom(c0, c1)), wfun(c2)), wceq(ccom(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), cdm(c2)), wral(s6, cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), wceq(cfv(ccom(c0, c1), cv(s6)), cfv(c2, cv(s6)))))
  eqtr4i(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), cdm(c2), universe)
  dmmpti(s4, c2, universe, ciun(s5, c6, co(cv(s4), c4, cv(s5))))
  iunex(s5, c6, co(cv(s4), c4, cv(s5)))
  ovex(cv(s4), c4, cv(s5))

blocks.name: iunrelexpmin1
blocks.content: The indexed union of relation exponentiation over the natural numbers is the minimum transitive relation that includes the relation. (Contributed by RP, 4-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexpmulnn
blocks.content: With exponents limited to the counting numbers, the composition of powers of a relation is the relation raised to the product of exponents. (Contributed by RP, 13-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexpmulg
blocks.content: With ordered exponents, the composition of powers of a relation is the relation raised to the product of exponents. (Contributed by RP, 13-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: trclrelexplem
blocks.content: The union of relational powers to positive multiples of ` N ` is a subset to the transitive closure raised to the power of ` N ` . (Contributed by RP, 15-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: iunrelexpmin2
blocks.content: The indexed union of relation exponentiation over the natural numbers (including zero) is the minimum reflexive-transitive relation that includes the relation. (Contributed by RP, 4-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexp01min
blocks.content: With exponents limited to 0 and 1, the composition of powers of a relation is the relation raised to the minimum of exponents. (Contributed by RP, 12-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexp1idm
blocks.content: Repeated raising a relation to the first power is idempotent. (Contributed by RP, 12-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexp0idm
blocks.content: Repeated raising a relation to the zeroth power is idempotent. (Contributed by RP, 12-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexpxpmin
blocks.content: The composition of powers of a cross-product of non-disjoint sets is the cross product raised to the minimum exponent. (Contributed by RP, 13-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: relexpaddss
blocks.content: The composition of two powers of a relation is a subset of the relation raised to the sum of those exponents. This is equality where ` R ` is a relation as shown by ~ relexpaddd or when the sum of the powers isn't 1 as shown by ~ relexpaddg . (Contributed by RP, 3-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm relexpaddss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3)), wss(ccom(co(c2, crelexp, c0), co(c2, crelexp, c1)), co(c2, crelexp, co(c0, caddc, c1))))
} = {
  3imp(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3), wss(ccom(co(c2, crelexp, c0), co(c2, crelexp, c1)), co(c2, crelexp, co(c0, caddc, c1))))
  syl5bi(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wi(wcel(c2, c3), wss(ccom(co(c2, crelexp, c0), co(c2, crelexp, c1)), co(c2, crelexp, co(c0, caddc, c1)))), wo(wcel(c1, cn), wceq(c1, nat0)))
  elnn0(c1)
  jaod(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(c1, nat0), wi(wcel(c2, c3), wss(ccom(co(c2, crelexp, c0), co(c2, crelexp, c1)), co(c2, crelexp, co(c0, caddc, c1)))))
  syl(wcel(c0, cn0), wi(wcel(c1, cn), wi(wcel(c2, c3), wss(ccom(co(c2, crelexp, c0), co(c2, crelexp, c1)), co(c2, crelexp, co(c0, caddc, c1))))), wo(wcel(c0, cn), wceq(c0, nat0)))

blocks.name: iunrelexpuztr
blocks.content: The indexed union of relation exponentiation over upper integers is a transive relation. Generalized from ~ rtrclreclem3 . (Contributed by RP, 4-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm iunrelexpuztr(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wss(ccom(cfv(c4, c0), cfv(c4, c0)), cfv(c4, c0)))
  -| wceq(c4, cmpt(s0, universe, ciun(s1, c2, co(cv(s0), crelexp, cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffcc(c2, c4)
} = {
  mpd(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wss(ccom(cfv(c4, c0), cfv(c4, c0)), cfv(c4, c0)), wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wal(hs3, wi(wa(wrex(hs2, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1))), wrex(hs4, c2, wbr(cv(hs1), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs4)), cv(hs3)))), wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(s1)), cv(hs3))))))))
  alrimiv(hs0, w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wal(hs1, wal(hs3, wi(wa(wrex(hs2, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1))), wrex(hs4, c2, wbr(cv(hs1), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs4)), cv(hs3)))), wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(s1)), cv(hs3)))))))
  alrimiv(hs1, w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wal(hs3, wi(wa(wrex(hs2, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1))), wrex(hs4, c2, wbr(cv(hs1), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs4)), cv(hs3)))), wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(s1)), cv(hs3))))))
  alrimiv(hs3, w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wi(wa(wrex(hs2, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1))), wrex(hs4, c2, wbr(cv(hs1), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs4)), cv(hs3)))), wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(s1)), cv(hs3)))))
  3imtr4g(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wa(wrex(hs2, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1))), wrex(hs4, c2, wbr(cv(hs1), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs4)), cv(hs3)))), wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(s1)), cv(hs3))), wex(hs2, wex(hs4, wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs2), c2), wcel(cv(hs4), c2)), wa(wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs1), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs4)), cv(hs3)))))), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c2), wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, crelexp, cv(s1)), cv(hs3)))))
